info.label: Developer
info.brief: I am a 44-year-old all-round Java backend developer and productivity nerd interested in tackling server side programming with Spring, infrastructure, automation and bot-related problems.
info.quote: Tell me and I forget, teach me and I may remember, involve me and I learn. ― Benjamin Franklin

employment.summary: Optional overall employment summary. Not used in most themes.

history.summary: I've experimented and made recommendations to the development teams about the adoption of new technologies and tools. Provided support on tecnical problems and mentorship to junior members.
highlights: I've completely automated the creation/destruction of the development environments for next-gen IoT platform on AWS using Terraform (provisioning), Ansible (coniguration management) and Jenkins+bot (orchestration).

Created a [Slack bot](https://github.com/zmoog/dickbott/tree/master/scripts/slack) using the [DickBott](https://github.com/zmoog/dickbott) serverless framework to [start/stop EC2](https://github.com/zmoog/dickbott/tree/master/scripts/aws/ec2), RDS or [drain Autoscaling Groups](https://github.com/zmoog/dickbott/tree/master/scripts/aws/autoscaling) to save resources (and money!) over the nights and weekends and streamline the development processes.
Setup a non-trivial AWS Organization, AWS SSO (integrated with the company Active Directory) and on-premise integration using Transit Gateway and VPNs.
Organized (and teached) multiple internal courses on AWS, Ansible and DevOps practices.
Sustained an automation mindset using build tools, bots and best practices.

history.summary: I've contribuited to the CNH IoT platform as a backend and infrastructure engineer, helping to define a streamlined process to deliver the application releases to the client. Developed a fair amount of the AWS infrastructure as code of the next-gen plaform for fleet management.
highlights: Contribuited code and improved processes in the current-gen Java-based IoT platform for the client CNH.
Worked hard on the next-gen IoT plaform built on AWS to support a very large number of devices.
Built a shared (micro) service to support enable/disabile SIMs and data service on mobile network providers used by the devices deployed on the field.

Setup multiple internal services (a complete [Zanata](http://zanata.org) server and a multiple nodes [Redis](https://redis.io/topics/cluster-tutorial) master-slave cluster /w automatic failover using Sentinels) on our on-premise data center using Ansible.
Started to really love teaching to other team members.

history.summary: I've mostly built backend systems for various web sites and online shop using the Django web framework and Python language. Another major part here was coaching the younger team mates to improve their technical and organizational skills (this part war really fun and engaging!)
highlights: Finally working in a Python/Django shop full-time.
Young and fast-moving work environment.
Pushed my organizational skills to the limit with multiple small project streams.

history.summary: Built multiple ECM and BPM applications for clients in the telecomunication industry, mostly [TIM](https://www.tim.it) and affiliates, using the Java language with the Spring Framework and related ecosystem.
highlights: Built a BPM solution for taking orders from Tibco, feed a contact center and than ship products using a courier. The system was completly Java based and built using Spring Framework, Spring Integration and Spring Batch.

Developed a BPM system to plan the periodic collection of the paper contracts signed by the consumers on the TIM stores in Italy and ship them to the central document wharehouse for scanning and long term storage. This was another Java based system, with a web frontend for backoffice users and integration service to send and receive data from the couriers.
Built a strong relationship with the client providing effective solutions leveraging on the battle tested Java platform and the Spring ecosystem.

history.summary: I've developed APIs to export data from the legacy application for data visualizations and KPI. Started a prototype for a data collection project with device (C/C++) and backend (Python) code that it's still used today, after 10 years.
highlights: Replaced a bunch scheduled Excel workbooks with a modern Django web application providing real-time data.
Added an API layer to access legacy data stored in an Oracle database using Java and Spring.
Started a data collection system prototype (both device and backend) that it's saving manual data entry since 2009.
Enjoyed a totally different working environment.

history.summary: I've worked on the backend systems for [CSI Piemonte](http://www.csipiemonte.it/web/en/), an Italian public sector ICT services provider focusing on the [Identity Management providers](http://www.sistemapiemonte.it/cms/pa/sicurezza).
highlights: Learned to tackle the complexity of the rules and relations in a public sector company.

history.summary: I've helped with the on-boarding the new client [State Street Bank](http://www.statestreet.com/about/office-locations/italy.html) on the company flagship product [XF](http://sistinf.it/en/offerta/soluzioni/xf-extended-financial-services.html).
highlights: Helped with the networking stuff between the web backend and and the AS400.
Repurposed old desktop PCs as a network devices using Linux in the early stages of the deployment (oh, some real fun!).
One day I'll can tell my nephews to have seen a real AS400.

history.summary: I was in the core team of the [Fiat Link](http://www.fiatpress.com/press/article/fiat-link-fiat-auto-s-innovative-sales-and-service-system) project, web based sales and service application in the FCA dealership around the world.
highlights: Worked on core parts of the system (i18n, taxes and more).
Huge (30+) and international development team.
The codebase was really massive and the daily work was really challenging (somewhat in a good way, I've learened a lot from thie experience).

history.summary: I've designed few subsystems in the MSP (Motore Servizi Prepagato) application used by [TIM](https://www.tim.it) in the prepaid SIMs. In this project I haven't writted a single line of Java code and just using [Rational Rose](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IBM_Rational_Rose_XDE) all day long.
highlights: First ever codeless work experience.
Working on a complex and missing-critical application is really challenging.
Developed new skills talking and writing design documents with a high profile cient.

history.summary: This was a narrow focused gig: porting a well-established financial application from IBM WebShpere 3.x to 4.x.
highlights: The most valuable skills were patience and attention to the details.

history.summary: Implemented few minor parts in the backend of a prototype web application for [Reale Mutua Assicurazione](https://www.realemutua.it).
highlights: This was my first exposure to the EJBs from J2EE platform.
Complex integration with legacy systems written in COBOL language and running on an IBM mainframe.

history.summary: I've been the developer and maintainer of the import/export tools, used written in C++ for the IBM AIX platform, for the exchange of [Eurofighter Typhoon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eurofighter_Typhoon) aircraft data and CAD models.
highlights: Maintained a sync engine for the exchange of [ISO 10303 (STEP)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_10303) product manufacturing informations between the members of Eurofighter Typhoon consortium.
Gained the trust of the engineering team that used the data synchronized by the other Eurofighter partners.
Survived in a challenging environment.

history.summary: Maintained a warehouse management system for [Pininfarina](http://www.pininfarina.com/it/homepage/homepage.htm) automaker.
highlights: I've worked on code, support and client relations.
Learned that every line of code must have a purpose and a customer value.
Run the wild ride of a small business in a big company.

projects.title: DickBott
projects.summary: Conceived, designed, implemented, and created a framework for serverless Slack bots with TypeScript language on AWS using DialogFlow for NLP.
highlights: This framework has been used to build multiple bots for automations such as build/destroy application environments, start/stop EC2 instances, RDS database instance or just deliver infrastructure information to non technical people.
Serverless application that can run at no cost using the AWS free tier resources.
Contribuited to create and sustain an automation culture in the team and in the company.
I used it to automate some family-related tasks, such as check the balance on the kids school canteen or download the PDF version of the newspaper subscription and avoid their crappy app for iOS.

reading.title: The Devops Handbook: How to Create World-Class Agility, Reliability, & Security in Technology Organizations
reading.author: Gene Kim, Jez Humble, Patrick Debois, John Willis and John Allspaw.
reading.summary: For decades, technology leaders have struggled to balance agility, reliability, and security, and the consequences of failure have never been greater. The effective management of technology is critical for business competitiveness. High-performing organizations are 2.5 times more likely to exceed profitability, market share, and productivity goals.The DevOps Handbook shows leaders how to create the cultural norms and the technical practices necessary to maximize organizational learning, increase employee satisfaction, and win in the marketplace.

reading.title: The Phoenix Project: A Novel About IT, DevOps, and Helping Your Business Win
reading.author: Gene Kim, Kevin Behr, George Spafford.
reading.summary: Bill has 90 days to fix a behind-schedule IT project, or his entire department will be outsourced. Fortunately, he has the help of a prospective board member, whose 'Three Ways' philosophy might just save the day.

speaking.title: Tutor
speaking.summary: I have been a tutor in the summer 2016 edition of Django Girls in Turin. Django Girls is a non-profit organization and a community that empowers and helps women to organize free, one-day programming workshops by providing tools, resources and support.

speaking.title: Automatizzare i deploy di applicazioni Django con Ansible
highlights: Describes what Ansible is, what are its components (Playbook, Play, Inventory, Task and Module).
In order to make the deployment operations accessible to non-technical members of the team, the use of a chat bot is proposed.
Using Ansible the deployment process remains well described and always up-to-date.
speaking.summary: This talk (in Italian, with [abstract](https://www.pycon.it/conference/talks/automatizzare-i-deploy-di-applicazioni-django-con-ansible) and the [complete YouTube video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yRaL3IkBwNs) available) describes how it's possible to perform frequent and reliable deployments of Django-based web applications using Ansible.
